summary: Test server download breaks when Java releases are broken or missing assets, affecting users' automated testing and npm installation. The issue discusses coupling to a fixed working version, fallback logic, or CDN-based distribution.
userImpact: Users experience broken automated testing when Java test server releases are broken or lack assets, causing npm install failures.
rootCause: Test server download script depends on latest Java SDK release having properly built test server assets, with no fallback mechanism.
proposedFix: Point @temporalio/testing package to a fixed test server version for consistency, use temporal.download service to cache requests and control version serving, or add fallback logic to try previous versions.
resolutionDetails: Resolved by leveraging temporal.download service to cache requests and control which test server version is served, eliminating rate-limiting issues and providing version control.
keyQuote: point the @temporalio/testing package to a fixed test server version, that way there are no surprises
